title: Split 'each' compound ingredients into separate lines
description:
Lines like '1/2 tsp each salt and pepper' currently parse as a single ingredient with unit 'tsp each' and item 'salt and pepper'. The correct interpretation is two separate ingredients: '1/2 tsp salt' and '1/2 tsp pepper'. This would require the parser (or a post-processing step) to detect the 'each' qualifier on the unit and split the compound item list (separated by 'and', commas, or both) into individual ingredients, duplicating the measurement for each.

Affects ~11 ingredients across the pipeline corpus. Examples:
- '1/2 tsp each salt and pepper' -> '1/2 tsp salt' + '1/2 tsp pepper'
- '1 tablespoon each dried oregano and cumin' -> '1 tbsp dried oregano' + '1 tbsp cumin'
- '1/2 teaspoon each ground cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and cardamom' -> 4 separate ingredients

See doc/ingredient-parsing.md for workflow and file locations.
